rounds.comments: (Ken: We'll give you one actor on TV and one in the movies; you'll have to name the role in common.)

clues.text:
Adam West &
among many others,
Ben Affleck

George Takei &
John Cho,
boldly going

Don Johnson &
Colin Farrell
had their vices

My dear guests,
Ricardo Montalbán & Michael Peña
were your host
Sorrell Booke & Burt Reynolds, in charge in Hazzard county

The Bargello in this city has had many uses over the centuries; for a while, it was Leonardo da Vinci's dad's office
Oslo's Kon-Tiki Museum also has a later boat, made of papyrus & named for this Egyptian god; it went from Africa to the Americas
The Tango Museum, where the classic "La Cumparsita" was born, is not in Argentina but in this country to the east
Naturally a skull of Homo senegalensis was part of the 2018 inaugural exhibit of this capital's Museum of Black Civilizations
On June 11 Hawaii celebrates the deeds of this great king & warrior
This country's King Mohammed VI has a law degree from Mohammed V University, founded by & named for his grandfather
The younger brother of French kings Louis XVI & Louis XVIII, this king the X ruled in his own right
The title subject of 2 Shakespeare plays, he was England's first king of the house of Lancaster
Constantine I returned to the throne of this country in 1920 after King Alexander was bitten by a pet monkey & died
It comes before "get this bread" in a forward-thinking money-making meme
This contraction opens the poem "A Visit from St. Nicholas"
This double contraction is often uttered after someone brings something to a party after being told not to
This contraction is in the alternate name of the patriotic song "America"
This contraction meaning "between" is often paired with the contraction "'tween" for all your between needs

Strait separating sizable superpowers

Over a million people live in the Canary Islands which constitute 2 provinces of this country

Varieties of this green garnish, related to the mustard plant, include winter, garden & water

This queen of France was skating around 1776 --possibly on thin ice

Men started competing in this type of skating at the 1924 Olympics; women not until 1960

Lewis & Clark called these Great Plains mammals "barking squirrels"
The best known of these weather forecasting rodents is Punxsutawney Phil
Contrary to popular opinion, these rodents do not deliberately commit suicide in the sea
This little "golden" pet's name is from the German for "hoarder" since he stores food in his cheeks
Native to the Andes Mountains, these rodents, known for their dense fur, now are mainly raised on ranches

His father urged him to study science, which he used in the novels "Cat's Cradle" & "Slaughterhouse-Five"
Both politicians & both named Edmund, neither he nor his father "Pat" used Edmund as a first name

Word that means "citified", or the name taken by 8 Roman Catholic popes

Born in Crete, he moved from Italy to Spain during the Inquisition & it's reflected in his work

rounds.text: The name of this woman, the product of an incestuous union, means "against birth"
